servinfo.title: DTC P0011 / P0012: Camshaft Position - Timing Over-Advanced or System Performance / -Retarded (For M16 Engine)

servinfosub.title: System Description
servinfosub.ptxt: Actual value of advanced valve timing does not reach target value.
Valve timing is advanced although ECM command is most retarding.

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Actual advanced valve timing is less than 2.1° crank angle for more than 13 sec even though target advanced valve timing is more than 5.6° crank angle with acceleration for more than 30 sec at engine speed more than 1600 rpm.
Actual valve timing is advanced more than 11.25° crank angle although ECM command is retarding.

item.ptxt: Intake camshaft timing sprocket (Camshaft position control (VVT) actuator)
When performing a road test, select a place where there is no traffic or possibility of a traffic accident and be very careful during testing to avoid occurrence of an accident.
Road test should be carried out by 2 persons, a driver and tester, on a level road.

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that the following conditions are satisfied when using this “DTC Confirmation Procedure”.

item.ptxt: altitude (barometric pressure): 2400 m, 8000 ft or less (560 mmHg, 75 kPa or more)

s1.ptxt: Clear DTC. Refer to DTC Clearance:For Petrol Engine Model .
Start engine and drive vehicle under usual driving condition for 5 minutes or longer until engine is warmed up to normal operating temperature.
Run engine at idle speed for 1 minute.
Start vehicle and increase vehicle speed up to 80 km/h (50 mile/h).
Keep vehicle speed at 80 km/h (50 mile/h) for 1 minute or longer at 5th gear position.
Stop vehicle and turn OFF ignition switch.
Check DTC. Refer to DTC Check:For Petrol Engine Model .

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:For Petrol Engine Model .

action.ptxt: Go to DTC P0010: Camshaft Position Actuator Circuit (For M16 Engine):For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Do you have SUZUKI scan tool?

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect SUZUKI scan tool.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Check that “VVT GAP” displayed on SUZUKI scan tool is 0 – 5°.

paragroup.ptxt: Check valve timing referring to Timing Chain and Chain Tensioner Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT . If OK, go to Step 5.

test1.ptxt: Check that “VVT GAP” displayed on SUZUKI scan tool is 0 – 5°.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Remove cylinder head cover referring to Cylinder Head Cover Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Check oil pressure leakage from oil control circuit.

testgroup.title: Oil control valve and oil gallery pipe check

test1.ptxt: Remove oil control valve referring to Oil Control Valve Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Remove oil gallery pipe referring to Timing Chain Cover Removal and Installation:For M16A Engine with VVT .
Check oil gallery pipe and oil control valve for clog or sludge.

testgroup.question: Are they in good condition?

paragroup.ptxt: Clean oil control valve and oil gallery pipe. Replace oil control valve if a problem is not solved after cleaning oil control valve and oil gallery pipe.

testgroup.title: Oil control valve electrical circuit check

test1.ptxt: Check that oil control valve circuit is in good condition referring to DTC P0010: Camshaft Position Actuator Circuit (For M16 Engine):For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Is circuit in good condition?

test1.ptxt: Check oil control valve referring to Oil Control Valve Inspection:For M16A Engine with VVT .
